description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d34mf","text":"This is the protocol for a systematic review and meta-analysis to systematically and quantitatively evaluate the mortality rate and time-period mortality after hip fracture and spinal fracture in patients with ESKD treated with hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, or kidney transplantation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u0t2","text":"Hip fracture is one of the major health problems in patients with end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) requiring renal replacement therapy, including hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, or kidney transplantation, because they have a higher risk for hip fracture than the general population 123. In addition, several studies have demonstrated that hip fracture had a high burden of morbidity and mortality, and costs in patients with ESKD 456. Along with the aging of the dialysis population, the increased risk of fractures may be explained by changes in phosphorus handling, vitamin D metabolism, and alternations in parathyroid hormone production and secretion associated with exacerbation of renal impairment 7. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":284,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":432,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":706,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3agb9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6t275","text":"Although prior studies have reported mortality rates after hip fracture in those with ESKD 789, the reported mortality rates vary across studies. Besides, a comprehensive and quantitative analysis of each finding in these studies has not been conducted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":91,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5lbie","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"117ru","text":"Therefore, we aim to conduct a systematic review and meta-analysis to systematically and quantitatively evaluate the mortality rate and time-period mortality after hip fracture and spinal fracture in patients with ESKD treated with hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, or kidney transplantation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"omgc","text":"What are the mortality rate, 1-year mortality, and 5-year mortality after hip fracture and spinal fracture in patients with ESKD treated with hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis, or kidney transplant?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bu6ae","text":"We followed the Preferred reporting items for systematic review and meta-analysis protocols (PRISMA-P) 2015 10 for preparing this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":108,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bnjvh","text":"Inclusion criteria of articles for the review","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ejchl","text":"4.1.1. Types of included studies","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9g10u","text":"We will include prospective and retrospective cohort studies, including cohorts from controlled trials, that describe outcomes after hip or spinal fracture in patients with ESKD treated with hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis or kidney transplant. We will also include original reports such as case series in which all participants had mortality outcomes or cohort studies. We will not restrict publication date and status (full publication, conference abstract, and unpublished data).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3523t","text":"We will exclude case reports with three cases or less, animal and laboratory studies, and literature reviews. We will also exclude not yet recruiting, recruiting, or withdrawn studies in Clinical.Trial.gov.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fo0fq","text":"4.1.2. Study participants","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6o6pl","text":"Inclusion criteria:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5sh07","text":"We will include patients with ESKD treated with hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis or kidney transplant, regardless of the etiology of chronic kidney disease, follow-up duration, and country of origin. We will include patients of any age, sex, and race.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7j7s6","text":"Exclusion criteria:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"alnth","text":"None.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6i5d7","text":"4.1.3. Intervention(s) or exposure(s)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"un5t","text":"Not applicable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bvafv","text":"4.1.4. Comparator(s) or control(s)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"br6f6","text":"Not applicable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1a9o","text":"Type of outcomes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"10eq4","text":"4.2.1. Primary outcomes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e8sin","text":"Mortality rate, 1-year mortality, and 5-year mortality after hip fracture.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"99rt","text":"Mortality rate, 1-year mortality, and 5-year mortality after spinal fracture.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed5cf","text":"Search methods","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9v0hm","text":"4.3.1. Electronic search","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7kqj6","text":"We will search Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials (CENTRAL), MEDLINE via PubMed, and EMBASE via ProQuest Dialog. See Appendix 1, 2, and 3 for the search strategies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mb89","text":"4.3.2. Other sources","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eo8rd","text":"For ongoing or unpublished trials, we will also search World Health Organization International Clinical Trials Platform Search Portal (ICTRP) and ClinicalTrials.gov, as shown in Appendix 4 and 5. We will also confirm paper references including the extracted studies. We will ask the authors of original studies for unpublished or additional data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"321ok","text":"Data collection and analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6rvll","text":"4.4.1. Selection of the studies","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7kvvn","text":"Two independent authors will screen the titles and abstracts of studies identified using the search strategy against the inclusion and exclusion criteria. The full text of the potentially eligible studies will be obtained and independently assessed for eligibility by two authors. If we are not sure whether the studies meet the inclusion criteria because of the abstract only, we will contact the original authors of these studies. Any disagreements will be resolved by discussion, and if this fails, a third reviewer will act as an arbiter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8gtmv","text":"4.4.2. Data extraction and management","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4kfmd","text":"Two review authors will perform data extraction for the studies independently. The 1-year and 5-year mortality will be extracted, but the mortality less than 1 year will not be extracted. We will extract the data if studies report the mortality of more than 1 year and less than 5 years (e.g., 2-year mortality), but do not report either 1-year or 5-year mortality. In that case, the outcome data for less than 3 years will be included as 1-year mortality, and the data for 3 to 5 years will be included as 5-year mortality. We will perform a sensitivity analysis excluding the outcome data other than 1-year and 5-year mortality to confirm the robustness of the main results. Any disagreements will be resolved by discussion, and if this fails, a third reviewer will act as an arbiter. We will contact the original authors if necessary. We will use data extraction which was checked beforehand for 10 randomly selected studies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bgsll","text":"Assessment of risk of bias in included studies","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5gnss","text":"Two review authors will independently assess the risk of bias for each study using the Joanna Briggs Institute Prevalence Critical Appraisal Tool 1112. We will assess the following domains:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":146,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ct18t","text":"Was the sample frame appropriate to address the target population?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bdglo","text":"Were study participants sampled in an appropriate way?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7b0d1","text":"Was the sample size adequate?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8crpu","text":"Were the study subjects and the setting described in detail?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dinlk","text":"Was the data analysis conducted with sufficient coverage of the identified sample?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fdojr","text":"Were valid methods used for the identification of the condition?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1hhl2","text":"Was the condition measured in a standard, reliable way for all participants?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"as4ak","text":"Was there appropriate statistical analysis?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e2mpc","text":"Was the response rate adequate, and if not, was the low response rate managed appropriately?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cj1vd","text":"Any disagreements will be resolved by discussion, and if this fails, a third reviewer will act as an arbiter. In this study, the overall risk of bias will be calculated as the number of “Yes” responses for each domain divided by the total number of domains and expressed as a percentage. The overall risk of bias will be defined based on the calculated percentage as follows: \u003c50%: high risk of bias; 50% to 80%: moderate risk of bias; \u003e80%: low risk of bias). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8thuk","text":"Measures of treatment effects","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2102t","text":"Incidence rate and risk (incidence proportion) with 95% confidence intervals (CIs) and 95% prediction intervals. Incidence rate will be measured as the number of incident cases per measure of exposure and incidence proportion will be measured as the number of incident cases over a specified time frame. The statistical heterogeneity will be assessed using τ2 statistics, which provide a logit scale measure of between-study variance, represented in a more readily interpretable way by the 95% prediction intervals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":358,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19l4q","text":"Handling of missing data","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3fbmj","text":"We will not complement the missing values.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj4p8","text":"Assessment of heterogeneity","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8dl3t","text":"We will evaluate the statistical heterogeneity by visual inspection of the forest plots and calculating the I2 statistic (I2 values of 0% to 40%: might not be important; 30% to 60%: may represent moderate heterogeneity; 50% to 90%: may represent substantial heterogeneity; 75% to 100%: considerable heterogeneity). If heterogeneity is detected (I2\u003e50%), we will verify the possible causes. Cochrane Chi-square test (Q-test) will be performed to calculate I2 statistic, and P value less than 0.10 will be defined as statistically significant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":109,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":123,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":346,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":456,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":473,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aevgs","text":"Assessment of reporting bias","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"87f3r","text":"We will search the clinical trial registry system (ClinicalTrial.gov and ICTRP) to identify completed but unpublished studies. We will assess the potential publication bias by visual inspection of the funnel plot. Egger test will also be performed. Funnel plots are likely to be inaccurate in meta-analyses of prevalence studies with low proportions of outcomes 14, we will not conduct the test and visual inspection if we find less than 20 studies 1516or studies that have similar sample sizes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":362,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":449,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evstk","text":"Meta-analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dhpld","text":"We will use a single-arm analysis. For categorical variables, the percentage, mean, and standard deviation were calculated. We will calculate pooled incidence rate and incident proportion of death in patients with ESKD after hip fracture as well as in those with ESKD after spinal fracture. The random-effects model (DerSimonian and Laired method) will be used for pooled estimates to consider the variance between and among the studies. We will conduct statistical analyses using the R software (R Development Core Team 2019), with packages meta version 4.15-0 and metaphor version 2.4-0.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52k40","text":"Subgroup analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mci0","text":"To evaluate the clinical heterogeneity of study participants, we will perform subgroup analyses for primary outcomes with sex (men versus. women), race (Black versus. non-Blacks), presence or absence of cardiovascular diseases [hypertension, coronary artery disease, congestive heart failure, cerebrovascular disease, peripheral vascular disease], presence or absence of diabetes mellitus, types of renal replacement therapy (hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, or kidney transplant, and participants’ age category (Age ≥75 versus. Age \u003c75), if possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lfgk","text":"Sensitivity analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ed95k","text":"We will perform a sensitivity analysis limited to population-based cohort studies that describe outcomes after hip or spinal fracture in patients with ESKD treated with hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis or kidney transplant. We will also perform a sensitivity analysis excluding the outcome data other than 1-year and 5-year mortality to confirm the robustness of the main results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
